p.strong: Updated District Health Statement Regarding Coronavirus

span.div:
Dear Parents/Guardians;
I hope that this correspondence finds you and your families safe and healthy.Â As you are aware, Governor Murphy has closed the schools in New Jersey through May 15th.Â Our teachers are doing their very best to ensure that your children are provided with meaningful learning activities during these challenging times.
As we are now in the fourth marking period, I want to update you regarding how your children will be assessed during the remainder of the school year.Â The kindergarten students will be assessed in the same way that they have been throughout the year.Â The kindergarten teachers will ensure that your child is assessed appropriately while fully understanding that they are learning in a remote environment.Â The students is grades 1 through 8 will receive Pass/Fail grades for the fourth marking period.Â Please know that it is our goal that no student is negatively impacted due to the requirement that they learn remotely.Â I have complete confidence that our teachers will ensure that your child is assessed appropriately during the fourth marking period.
Please visit the District website regularly to receive further updates throughout the upcoming weeks.Â Once again, thank you for all that you are doing for your children and for the manner in which you are collaborating with our teaching staff.Â
Please be safe and healthy!

p.br:
Ralph P. Ferrie, Ed.D.
Interim CSA, Neptune City Public Schools
